shown in color d148 ruby one for hat one for mitts gauge 5 sts =1 over st st on larger needles needles 16 circular size 5 & 7 dpns size us 7 for hat & mitts hat begin with smaller needles loosely cast on 96 sts place marker and join in round work in k2 p2 rib for 1 5 change to larger needles begin working in mock cable as follows round 1 * k2 p2 repeat from * around round 2 * k1 yo k1 p2 repeat from * around round 3 * k3 p2 repeat from * around round 4 * slip 1 knitwise k2 psso the k2 p2 repeat from * around repeat mock cable pattern until total length is 7 ending with round 4 begin decreases as follows changing to double pointed needles when needed round 1 * k10 k2tog repeat from * to end round 2 * k9 k2tog repeat from * to end round 3 * k8 k2tog repeat from * to end round 4 * k7 k2tog repeat from * to end round 5 * k6 k2tog repeat from * to end round 6 * k5 k2tog repeat from * to end round 7 * k4 k2tog repeat from * to end round 8 * k3 k2tog repeat from * to end round 9 * k2 k2tog repeat from * to end round 10 * k1 k2tog repeat from * to end round 11 * k2tog repeat from * around 8 sts remain cut a long tail and with tapestry needle thread the remaining stitches and pull it tight weave in loose ends to finish abbreviations k = knit p = purl k2tog = knit 2 sts together psso = pass the slipped stitch over st s = stitch es round = round yo = yarn over p l y m o u t h y a r n® b185 free pattern with our compliments find inspiration www plymouthyarn com mitts begin with larger needles 40 sts divide onto 3 needles join being careful not to twist the sts work in k2-p2 ribbing until total length is 7 ending at the beginning of the round on the next round work as follows k2 p2 k1 bind off next 4 sts in ribbing k1 p2 k1 finish round as established next round cast on 4 sts over the bound off sts continue in ribbing around work in ribbing until total length is 10 or desired length bind off loosely in ribbing make a second mitt to match weave in all ends
